text: The cast of Allen Reisner’s 1958 bio-pic about the composer W. C. Handy is among the most distinguished in the history of cinema. https://t.co/5vp3IWt8RJ

name: NewYorker
text: Watching the commemoration of the 1995 Srebrenica genocide from the U.S.—a country so divided and dysfunctional that it is unable to effectively respond to the coronavirus—the issues of denialism took on new meaning, @RohdeD writes. https://t.co/5XQ40zSzgZ

name: NewYorker
text: Why did American policing get so big, so fast? The answer, mainly, is slavery. https://t.co/m1ZSWHfRwn

name: NewYorker
text: It is human nature to react to a moral decay by creating new institutions, the plague scholar Gianna Pomata says. Could COVID-19 create an opportunity for profound social change?  https://t.co/Hc3mvYjJeD

name: NewYorker
text: For the pyschotherapist Esther Perel, love is "an active engagement with all kinds of feelings—positive ones and primitive ones and loathsome ones. And it’s often surprising how it can kind of ebb and flow." https://t.co/Mr6vbqYTlH
